description: Instead of checking the value of FLAGS.allow_admin_api everywhere, this should be made into a decorator.
title: FLAGS.allow_admin_api should be turned into a decorator

comments.content: Instead of checking the value of FLAGS.allow_admin_api everywhere, this should be made into a decorator.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0

comments.content: It's only checked once at route creation time. If you put it in a decorator, can you still define the correct routes?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content: Good question. I suggested this in the event that we start using it in more places.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0

comments.content: yeah, it's never actually checked in the code. If you can't do admin operations, the routes are never established so they're short circuited anyway.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content: So it looks like a decorator is not really useful, since this is checked only once ? Closing as WONTFIX, please reopen if I understood this wrong.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
